item.title: Report E-2024090011
item.description:
Report E-2024090011

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-29
  • City: GRAND PRAIRIE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 29, 2024, at 0740 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Grand Prairie, Texas regarding the release of Techno Adhesive #199. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 110 gallons of Techno Adhesive #199 (UN1593, Adhesive, Dichloromethane (mixture), 6.1, III) from (2) 55-gallon DM’s. The release was caused by a forklift puncture and impacted 20ft x 8ft area of the trailer floor and a 20ft x 4ft area of concrete beneath the tanker. Contractors placed the 2 damaged drums into overpacks and cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste was containerized in (7) 55-gallon DF’s and (2) 95-gallon DF overpacks then staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024090036
item.description:
Report X-2024090036

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-21
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DMP WAS CALLED TO A LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE IN PD6. WHEN THE RESPONDER ARRIVED FOUND THE HAZMAT WAS WET BUT NOT ACTIVELY LEAKING. THE RESPONDER THEN CLEANED THE AREA FOLLOWING ALL DMP PROCEDURES. WHEN HE RETURNED TO DMP IT WAS FOUND THAT THE HAZMAT CONTAINED SEVERAL LEAKING CONTAINERS WITH LOOSE CAPS. THE PACKAGE WAS PROCESSED IN DMP WITHOUT INCIDENT.

item.title: Report E-2024090008
item.description:
Report E-2024090008

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-21
  • City: SANGER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 21, 2024, three (3) 5-gallon pails of UN1263 were crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted site. The damaged pails and all impacted materials were containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

  • Description: It was reported that a 55-gallon metal drum of Nipar S 10 3001 was damaged due to punctures to the top of the drum due to improper loading. The release impacted trailer #3110070. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with the PPE available on-site.

item.title: Report E-2024080726
item.description:
Report E-2024080726

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-02T09:14:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-19
  • City: IRVING
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 19, 2024, four (4) 1-gallon jugs of UN1789 were damaged in transit and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH crew deployed granular absorbents and worked them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and the damaged jugs were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.
